body_html:
Indeed, for inference you probably want to run some small fixed number of
time steps at a time yourself (since you need to decide when to stop based
on your business logic); in which case you just want to build a tf.nn.rnn
with that small number of inputs.

On Mon, Aug 1, 2016 at 1:07 AM, doubler notifications@github.com wrote:

I found tf.nn.dynamic_rnn is much slower than tf.nn.rnn in
tensorflow_serving inference.
Using tf.version == 0.9.0

—

body:
Indeed, for inference you probably want to run some small fixed number of
time steps at a time yourself (since you need to decide when to stop based
on your business logic); in which case you just want to build a tf.nn.rnn
with that small number of inputs.

On Mon, Aug 1, 2016 at 1:07 AM, doubler notifications@github.com wrote:

> I found tf.nn.dynamic_rnn is much slower than tf.nn.rnn in
> tensorflow_serving inference.
> Using tf._version_ == 0.9.0
>
